name: Mercure Nice Grimaldi

reviews.text: Got a fantastic deal ( three nights for the price of two) on [----] at the Mercure Grimaldi Nice. Like the city itself, the hotel is undergoing some refurbishment. Flat-screen televisions and new AC were being added during my stay so there was quite a lot of noise. This aside, I could not really fault it as the main work was carried out during the day when the guests were out. My room, though a little
reviews.title: Good Centrally Located 3* Hotel

reviews.text: dated, was spacious, had lots of storage, two writing desks with chairs, and was spotless as was the bathroom. Tea/coffee making facilities are not available in the rooms but maybe this is the norm in France. Breakfast - included in the deal - was excellent with loads of choice. I was really set up for the day and the staff, including those at reception, were very friendly and helpful. One of the best things going for this hotel is the location. It is right in the middle of everything and avid shoppers have loads of choice with designer shops as well as mid-range outlets and an abundance of good restaurants within easy reach. Most of the main shopping area in Nice is a building site but this is due to be completed soon. The promenade and beach are just a short walk away as is the bus stop / drop-off point for the 20 minute journey to the airport. The ticket at €4, and valid throughout the system for the day, is fantastic value and there is a frequent service. This hotel reflects its 3 star rating and with ongoing improvements and its unbeatable location
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a perfect location
Good value
reviews.text: I would have no hesitation in returning to the Mercure Nice Grimaldi.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a good base from which to explore the many tourist sites that Cote d'Azur has to offer and with the city's new tram system on the horizon, Nice, with its well serviced airport will be an even more enjoyable destination than it already is.
reviews.title: Very nice central hotel

reviews.text: The Mercure Grimaldi is very centrally located in Nice, right along a pedestrian zone with many shops (mainly clothes) in a wide range of prices. If you'd rather stroll along the Promenade d'Anglais, it's two blocks away. Heading for Vieux Nice (the old town)? Allow 15 minutes, and you even have time for some window shopping on the way. Add to this clean, medium sized rooms, nice bathroom, helpful staff and a sufficient breakfast (actually abundant to French standards), and you have found your hotel!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives first. Air con in bedroom struggled to cope with high temps even at night. Towels miniscule but clean. No air con in bathroom.Now the good...
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good sized room. 4 floors devoted to non-smoking 2 to the addicts. Bathroom clean and good size bedroom with ample storage space. Flat screen TV BBC World & CNN only channels in English.Safe key free on request. Breakfast on the expensive side 13.5 euros but worth it for the convenience and by French standards a good choice of cold foods. Hot bacon and scrambled eggs best avoided unless you are grease lovers. Breakfast served 6.30-10.30 weekdays.
reviews.title: It's ok at Mercure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception service excellent , warm and welcoming.
reviews.title: Terrific

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Utilizing tripadvisor tips tried Restaurant Davia. Food good but cramped and small tables.Just up Rue Grimaldi next to Hotel Grimaldi. Seems some tripadvisor comments re Mercure Nice Grimaldi are from American guests of Le Grimaldi going by their geographical descriptions. ? Could this be inflating Mercure Nice Grimaldi ratings as Le Grimaldi is higher grade?
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in great location

reviews.text: If taking Bus 98 from Airport to this hotel alight at Bus stop Casino Ruhl on Promenade des Anglais before you get to Place
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located. As you walk out of the hotel you are a short distance away from the shops and restaurants. Only five minutes from the excellent promenade which is a gorgeous walk if you wish to walk along. No parking but not a problem if you have travelled via plane and travelled on foot ie by bus etc.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel-very friendly

likes.disliked: — Breakfast - hot foods were too greasy

reviews.text: The worst Mercure hotel I ever stayed!
reviews.title: Grimaldi - forget it
OK Choice
reviews.text: Even if travelling alone on business, I booked a double room.

reviews.title: Well worth staying at Mercure Grimaldi
reviews.text: Upon arrival when entering the room, I saw they tried to put me in a shoe-box! It was such a small room I could not put my suitcase on the floor and opening it! Also website stated hotel was refurbished, my room was all worn - furniture, bed, carpet, painting on walls, bathroom, everything!

reviews.title: Good location, Reliable older Mercure hotel with good large rooms
reviews.text: There were no racks at all in bathroom, toilet was dripping, and I could not close the door.
The wrinting desk was so small there was not enough space to put my laptop on it, had to remove first telephone and hotel brochures.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel in a Brilliant Location
Good mid range budget hotel - great location
reviews.text: The Mercure Grimaldi is centrally located close to the promenade shopping/restaurant/cafe strip, a short walk to the markets, old part of town and train station.The hotel has a carpark next door with reasonably priced parking.

When choosing a 2 star hotel, one of my biggest concern is cleanliness. Thank goodness for Tripadvisor which helped me choose this hotel... it is very clean and comfortable inside the rooms! The housekeeping staff (and hotel staff in general) was excellent.
reviews.title: Great location, very clean, great roof deck, some noise, horrid breakfast
Pretty good
reviews.text: The location is great -- 5 minute walk from the beach (perhaps 5 blocks) and all the old town shops and restaurants. 10 minutes to the train station and for business travellers it is a very pleasant 15 minute walk through scenic tree-lined boulevards to the Acropolis Convention Center. After spending 8 days in Nice, I came to the conclusion that I appreciated the relative quiet of this location rather than the hustle and bustle of the promenade with all it's automobile traffic, expecially since the location is so close anyway.

I got one of the cheaper rooms, only 75 Euro a night which I think was an excellent value. The bathroom was quite nice actually and as I said everything throughout the room was very clean. The bed was comfortable and the airconditioning worked fine. The mini bar kept drinks quite cold and I was able to include a few beers of my own in there to take up on the roof deck.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.text: The roof deck is wonderful and relaxing with lots of space, a ping pong table, views of the rooftops around, lounges, tables and even a covered circular room where people could sit. A great place to read the paper and relax in the sun.
reviews.title: Great for family of 4

reviews.text: One oddity - there is no clock in the room and since my cell phone does not work in Europe I sometimes had no idea what time it was! Also, no kettle in the room for making tea.
reviews.title: Up on the roof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came back from 5 days in Nice, and had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel. The room was clean and tidy. We had no issue with noise from other rooms or from the street below either. The room was actually bigger than I expected. (It was bigger than our room in Paris the week earlier at the Cardinal Rive Gauche).
reviews.title: A very nice stay at Mercure Grimaldi

reviews.text: The location is excellent. It is less than 1 minute away from the "Quartier Pietonnier" (walking district) with all the shops and restaurants, less than 5 minute walk to the beach, and less than 5 minute walk to beautiful Old Nice (a must!).
reviews.title: No Complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The main buses to Cannes/Antibes and St.Paul/Vence pass by the hotel on the corner. The hotel is also walking distance from the train station. We took the train from Paris. I think it took us approx 10 minutes, to walk to the hotel (but we were walking with luggage with slowed us down).
reviews.title: Superb boutique hotel

likes.liked: — Excellent location small boutique hotel lovely and clean

reviews.text: We found the Mercure Grimaldi - not to be confused with the more expensive "Grimaldi" on the same street - to be a good budget hotel for a short city break. It takes 15 minutes by cab from the airport (€40) but a bus does drop you nearby. The hotel is located about 2 minutes from the main shopping street and about 5 minutes from Old Nice and the sea-front. Also, about 10 minutes walk to the train station.
reviews.title: A Nice weekend

reviews.text: I was on 4th floor @ €97 per night which included breakfast. Room was clean and perfectly adequate and of a reasonable size - especially for France which is not known for large hotel rooms. Bed comfortable. Shower adequate. Couple of little niggles like the shower curtain kept getting in the way but that was all. Breakfast was adequate but I wouldn't have paid extra for it and certainly not the €13 ish list price!
reviews.title: very disapointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: WiFi in room (From Orange) was €4.50 for 1 hour to be used within 24 hrs but you could connect and disconnect. Hotel staff very helpful and produced an iron immediately upon request.
reviews.title: Mercure, Great location

likes.liked: — The room was a nice size and clean.
likes.disliked: — The bar area didn't encourage having a drink and lounging around at night.

reviews.title: Very satisfied
reviews.text: It even transpired that those in the conference hotel facing forward got a lot of noise from about 4:00am onwards whereas I didn't. :~). I'd certainly stay there again.

description: This completely non smoking hotel offers 84 spacious rooms with airconditioning, cable TV and a refrigerator in the superior rooms. The Mercure Nice Grimaldi is located in the heart of town just 300 m from the famous Promenade des Anglais and close to the pedestrian area. Discover the refurbished superior rooms in this stylish establishment. Relax and enjoy the solarium on the 7th floor.
